subject: Re: [junit] junit code question
msgSnippet: ... Check out junit.extensions.TestSetup. That will show you the motivation for refactoring to Protectable. Perhaps it is not the best name, but I
messageBody:
<snip />
>Also, without intending to start a philosophical/religious debate,
>I was humbly wondering why TestCase::run() creates a TestResult,
>passes it to the run(TestResult) method which then turns the tables
>on TestResult and asks it to run the TestCase at which point the
>TestResult does the actual runBare() stuff? To my incredibly small
>brain, it's difficult to understand why a TestResult should know
>about running the TestCase.

Check out junit.extensions.TestSetup. That will show you the motivation for refactoring to Protectable. Perhaps it is not the best name, but I cannot think of a better one.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
